page.title: 06Farming - Beeches Farm
page.content: { Beeches Farm,}Fritton covers approximately 700 acres and is used partly for{arable}farming and partly for{livestock.}The{soil}varies from medium loam to heavy clay;{crops include winter wheat,winter barley, peas,sugar beet and some pasture for the cattle.50 Friesian{cattle}are kept in yards and fattened{for beef.}The young cattle are bought from farms in the west country and the fat animals are sent to local abbatoirs.Pest and diseases such as virus infections and scouring has to be controlled.Apart from the owners family,eight people are{employed}on the farm.Farming is highly{mechanised}with expensive equipment such as{tractors and combine {harvesters. Land values}are now very high with costs varying between Â£1500 and Â£2000 per acre.The{farm buldings are old and can be dated to 1650 AD
